## One brick

```{r}
#This is a brick
brick <- data.frame(
  Level="A",
  X1 = rep(3,4), #The number 3 is the brickrID for 'bright red'
  X2 = rep(3,4)
)

brick %>% 
  bricks_from_table() %>% 
  build_bricks()

#Rotate the default view for a better snapshot
rgl::par3d(userMatrix = rgl::rotate3d(rgl::par3d("userMatrix"), 0.75*pi, 0, 0 ,1))
```

```{r}
readxl::read_xlsx("brickr_release3.xlsx", sheet = "izzy-iggy") %>% 
  bricks_from_excel(
    #piece_table = readxl::read_xlsx("brickr_release3.xlsx", sheet = "brickr3_p")
  ) %>% 
  build_bricks(rgl_lit = FALSE, outline_bricks = TRUE,
               background_color =  "#99e7ff")

rgl::par3d(userMatrix = rgl::rotate3d(rgl::par3d("userMatrix"), .1*pi, 0, 0 ,1))

par3d(windowRect = c(20, 30, 900, 800))
```
